Who are the most powerful people in the criminal justice system?
GET TO KNOW YOUR COUNTY ATTORNEY

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Who are the most powerful people in our criminal justice system?

Answer: The most powerful person in the criminal justice system is your local county attorney.

What makes your county attorney so powerful?

Answer: As government prosecutors, they decide in criminal cases who is charged, the severity of those charges, or if any charges are filed. Put simply, they determine how most criminal cases are resolved.

How do county attorneys get to be county attorneys?

Answer: they are popularly elected just like state representatives and senators. And yet, they are often one of the least understood elected positions and least known by voters. This needs to change.

County attorneys' views on criminal justice policy set the tone for how our communities respond to societal issues. They have great influence on the police and Legislature. As elected officials, county attorneys need to be held accountable like any other elected official, and that begins by educating more voters about the importance of these positions across the state.

We encourage you to engage your candidate(s) for county attorney on the criminal justice reform issues most important to you. For starters, you can check out candidate responses to our questionnaire.

Civilly yours,

ACLU of New Hampshire
